ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk16:0.5_0: The second training rule on swaying the robe
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk16:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk16:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six were swaying and leaning their bodies while sitting in inhabited areas. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk16:1.3.1_0: “‘I will not sway my body while sitting in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk16:1.4_0: he should not sway his body while sitting in inhabited areas;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk16:1.5_0: one should sit keeping one’s body straight.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk16:1.6_0: If a monk, out of disrespect, sways and leans his body while sitting in an inhabited area, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk16:1.7.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk16:1.9_0: To give rise to the robe.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk16:1.12_0: if he has entered his dwelling;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk16:1.15_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk16:1.16_0: The sixth training rule is finished.
